div.p: Most illustrious man, may you be well.
I think it is not necessary to express what my feelings are towards you; God knows, and Aurelius knows. Therefore, there is no need for me to write more.
Aurelius is departing for the Court of the Rhetoricians by order of the most illustrious prince.
However, I wanted to visit you with my letters as a father, whom I love and value more each day; love me in return.
Greet the family and the school for me and pray to God for me, which is most important. Tübingen, May 13, 1564.
